DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Genotype-Tissue Expression Program Identifier Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A project-based unique identifier for a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A program sponsored by the National Institutes of Health's Common Fund, designed to provide insights into the mechanisms of gene regulation by studying human gene expression and regulation in multiple tissues from healthy individuals, exploring disease-related perturbations in a variety of human diseases, and examining sexual dimorphisms in gene expression and regulation in multiple tissues. Genetic variation between individuals will be examined for correlation with differences in gene expression level to identify regions of the genome that influence whether and how much a gene is expressed._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the alphanumeric unique identifier used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
